00104 // Agent++ configuration options
00105 //
00106 // (Note that Agent++ and SNMP++ should be built with the same settings!)
00107 
00108 // define _NO_LOGGING if you do not want any logging output 
00109 // (increases performance drastically and minimizes memory consumption)
00110 //#define _NO_LOGGING
00111 
00112 // define _NO_THREADS in snmp++/include/config_snmp_pp.h if you do not
00113 // want thread support
00114 
00115 // define _NO_SNMPv3 in snmp++/include/config_snmp_pp.h if you do not
00116 // want v3 support
00117 
00118 // snmp_pp.h includes config.h, which checks whether _SNMPv3 and
00119 // thread support are defined
00120 #include <snmp_pp/snmp_pp.h>
00121 
00122 
00123 // define _PROXY_FORWARDER for v1/v2c/v3 proxy agents
00124 #define _PROXY_FORWARDER
00125 
00126 #include <snmp_pp/smi.h>
00127 
00128 #define GENERIC_CLASS_SUCCESS           0
00129 #define GENERIC_CLASS_ERROR             1
00130 
00131 #define GENERIC_CLASS_TYPE_MISMATCH     -1
00132 
00133 #ifndef TRUE
00134 #define TRUE 1
00135 #endif
00136 
00137 #ifndef FALSE
00138 #define FALSE 0
00139 #endif
00140 
00141 #ifndef boolean
00142 #define boolean int
00143 #endif

00145 // internal "snmp" pdu types, used for internal mib updates
00146 // update: update one or more managed objects
00147 //         NOTE: if the target object is a table object and
00148 //               if the target object does not exist an new row is created
00149 // remove: remove one or more managed objects
00150 //         NOTE: if the target object is a table object 
00151 //               the complete row is removed
00152 
00153 #define MIB_UPDATE              (aSN_UNIVERSAL | aSN_CONSTRUCTOR | 0x0A )
00154 #define MIB_REMOVE              (aSN_UNIVERSAL | aSN_CONSTRUCTOR | 0x0B )
00155 
00156 typedef enum { READING, WRITING } access_types;
00157 
00158 #ifndef AGENTPP_DECL
00159         #if defined (WIN32) && defined (AGENT_PP_DLL)
00160                 #ifdef AGENT_PP_EXPORTS
00161                         #define AGENTPP_DECL __declspec(dllexport)
00162                         #define AGENTPP_DECL_TEMPL
00163                         #pragma warning (disable : 4018)        // signed/unsigned mismatch when exporting templates
00164                 #else
00165                         #define AGENTPP_DECL __declspec(dllimport)
00166                         #define AGENTPP_DECL_TEMPL extern
00167                         #pragma warning (disable : 4231)        // disable warnings on extern before template instantiation
00168                 #endif
00169         #else
00170                 #define AGENTPP_DECL
00171 // Seems that a eplicit extern declaration is needed on some 
00172 // systems. If you encounter linking problems you may uncomment
00173 // the following:
00174 //#ifdef WIN32 
00175                 #define AGENTPP_DECL_TEMPL
00176 //#else
00177 //              #define AGENTPP_DECL_TEMPL extern
00178 //#endif
00179         #endif
00180 #endif
00181

00189 // Options about program code alternatives

00191 // undef this if you want to use OrderedList instead OrderedArray
00192 #define USE_ARRAY_TEMPLATE
00193 
00194 // Define STATIC_REQUEST_LIST if you need a static RequestList in
00195 // Mib.
00196 //#define STATIC_REQUEST_LIST
00197 
00198 // ThreadPool may not work on any system so disable it if you encounter
00199 // problems
00200 #ifdef _THREADS
00201 #define AGENTPP_USE_THREAD_POOL
00202 
00203 // Use NO_FAST_MUTEXES on systems that do not allow a thread to unlock
00204 // a mutex it does not own. This has to be defined on WIN32 systems!
00205 #ifdef WIN32
00206 #define NO_FAST_MUTEXES
00207 #endif
00208 #endif //_THREADS
00209 
00210 // SnmpRequest and SnmpRequestV3 use temporary Snmpx objects for sending
00211 // traps, informs and requests. The default is to create these objects
00212 // with listen address 0.0.0.0. If you define this, they are created
00213 // using the listen address of the RequestList.
00214 #define USE_LISTEN_ADDRESS_FOR_SENDING_TRAPS

00220 #endif
00221 #endif
